metadata.Title: CVE-2017-12193 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
The assoc_array_insert_into_terminal_node function in lib/assoc_array.c in the Linux kernel before 4.13.11 mishandles node splitting, which allows local users to cause a denial of service (NULL pointer dereference and panic) via a crafted application, as demonstrated by the keyring key type, and key addition and link creation operations. Fan Wu, Haoran Qiu, and Shixiong Zhao discovered that the associative array implementation in the Linux kernel sometimes did not properly handle adding a new entry. A local attacker could use this to cause a denial of service (system crash).

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-12193` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.13.0-25-generic - 4.13.0-25.29
linux-image-4.13.0-25-generic-lpae - 4.13.0-25.29
linux-image-4.13.0-25-lowlatency - 4.13.0-25.29
linux-image-extra-4.13.0-25-generic - 4.13.0-25.29
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.15.0-1001-aws - 4.15.0-1001.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.15.0-1002-azure - 4.15.0-1002.2
linux-image-extra-4.15.0-1002-azure - 4.15.0-1002.2
